newsitem.title: USA: Sunbeam Corp responds to Steinhardt funds.
newsitem.headline: Sunbeam Corp responds to Steinhardt funds.

text.p: Sunbeam Corp responded on Wednesday to an announcement earlier in the day from Steinhardt funds, in which Steinhardt said it is distributing its shares of Sunbeam common stock to its investors.
The company said Shimon Topor, who served as Steinhardt's representative on Sunbeam's board, has resigned and that a replacement will be named shortly.
Sunbeam said Steinhardt announced in October 1995 that it planned to wind down all its funds and to distribute assets in the funds to investors by the end of 1996.
"We look forward to these investors continuing to share in the revitalization of Sunbeam as we work to increase shareholder value," Sunbeam Chief Executive Albert Dunlap said.
Sunbeam makes and sells outdoor and household brand name products. Its stock was up 1 1/2 on Wednesday at 24 3/4.
